Comment: There are funds which are only accessible under state of emergency. Including some federal funds.  On top of this it allows the executive, for a short time, to take actions which normally are not allowed without state legislature approval. Essentially it allows a short term dictatorship to allow things to move as quickly as the emergency requires.  Typically they must be short lived or redeclared every 30-90days, depending on the rules of the state.

Comment: This is both true and not; after the partial federalising of the National Guard, 'State Defense Forces' were legalised by the US Congress in 1956, and 22 states have them. If you are ever in the US and you see someone in a military uniform but with a state flag on the shoulder instead of the national one, they're in the State Defense Force and not the National Guard or the professional services.  Michigan's is called the ["Michigan Defense Force"](https://midefenseforce.org/).
